intro: Kanimia goyazensis, commonly known as the Goyazensis kanimia, is a flowering plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
